df-asin
blocks.content: Define the arcsine function. Because ` sin ` is not a one-to-one function, the literal inverse ` ``' sin ` is not a function. Rather than attempt to find the right domain on which to restrict ` sin ` in order to get a total function, we just define it in terms of ` log ` , which we already know is total (except at ` 0 ` ). There are branch points at ` -u 1 ` and ` 1 ` (at which the function is defined), and branch cuts along the real line not between ` -u 1 ` and ` 1 ` , which is to say ` ( -oo , -u 1 ) u. ( 1 , +oo ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: df-acos
blocks.content: Define the arccosine function. See also remarks for ~ df-asin . Since we define ` arccos ` in terms of ` arcsin ` , it shares the same branch points and cuts, namely ` ( -oo , -u 1 ) u. ( 1 , +oo ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: df-atan
blocks.content: Define the arctangent function. See also remarks for ~ df-asin . Unlike ` arcsin ` and ` arccos ` , this function is not defined everywhere, because ` tan ( z ) =/= +- _i ` for all ` z e. CC ` . For all other ` z ` , there is a formula for ` arctan ( z ) ` in terms of ` log ` , and we take that as the definition. Branch points are at ` +- _i ` ; branch cuts are on the pure imaginary axis not between ` -u _i ` and ` _i ` , which is to say ` { z e. CC | ( _i x. z ) e. ( -oo , -u 1 ) u. ( 1 , +oo ) } ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: asinlem
blocks.content: The argument to the logarithm in ~ df-asin is always nonzero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm asinlem(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wne(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), nat0))
} = {
  eqnetrrd(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), nat0, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cmin, cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), wcel(c0, cc))
  subnegd(co(ci, cmul, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))
  subne0d(co(ci, cmul, c0), cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), wcel(c0, cc))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), cc), wcel(ci, cc))
  mulcl(ci, c0)
  negcld(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wne(co(ci, cmul, c0), cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), wne(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), co(cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2)))
  3netr4d(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), co(cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2), co(nat0, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  mpbiri(wcel(c0, cc), wne(co(nat0, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wne(nat0, nat1))
  0ne1()
  syl3anc(wcel(c0, cc), wb(wne(co(nat0, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wne(nat0, nat1)), wcel(nat0, cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  0cnd(wcel(c0, cc))
  1cnd(wcel(c0, cc))
  necon3bid(co(nat0, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), nat0, nat1, w3a(wcel(nat0, cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc)))
  subcan2(nat0, nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  syl6eq(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), co(nat0, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cneg(co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  eqtrd(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), cneg(co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(co(ci, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), co(co(ci, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(ci, cc))
  ax-icn()
  sqmul(ci, c0)
  syl5eq(co(co(ci, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cneg(co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  oveq1i(co(ci, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2), cneg(nat1))
  i2()
  mulm1d(co(c0, cexp, nat2), wcel(c0, cc))
  df-neg(co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  eqtrd(co(cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cexp, nat2), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2), co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cexp, nat2)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cc))
  sqrtcld(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  sqneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))
  sqsqrtd(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  ax-1cn()
  sqcl(c0)
  subcl(nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  necon3i(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2), co(cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2), co(ci, cmul, c0), cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))))
  oveq1(co(ci, cmul, c0), cneg(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cexp, nat2)
}

blocks.name: asinlem2
blocks.content: The argument to the logarithm in ~ df-asin has the property that replacing ` A ` with ` -u A ` in the expression gives the reciprocal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)

thm asinlem2(class c0) {

  addcomd(co(ci, cmul, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))
  3eqtrd(co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2)))), co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cmin, co(ci, cmul, c0)), co(cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), caddc, cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))

  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(ci, cc))
  mulneg2(ci, c0)
  fveq2d(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2)), co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  oveq2d(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cexp, nat2), wcel(c0, cc))
  sqneg(c0)
  addcomd(cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))
  negcld(co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  negsubd(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  3eqtr3d(co(co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), caddc, co(ci, cmul, c0)), cmul, co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cmin, co(ci, cmul, c0))), co(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), caddc, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(co(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cexp, nat2)), co(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cmin, cneg(co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))

  sqmul(ci, c0)
  syl5eq(co(co(ci, cexp, nat2), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cneg(co(c0, cexp, nat2)), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))

  sqrtcld(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), cc), wcel(ci, cc))
  ax-icn()
  mulcl(ci, c0)
  subsq(cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), co(ci, cmul, c0))

  subcl(nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), caddc, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), nat1), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  ax-1cn()
  sqcl(c0)
  npcan(nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
}

blocks.name: asinlem3a

  eqtrd(cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), co(cneg(cfv(cim, c0)), caddc, cfv(cre, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), co(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(cre, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)))

  mulcl(ci, c0)

  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)), wcel(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  ax-1cn()
  adantr(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  sqcl(c0)
  subcl(nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  oveq1d(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(cre, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cneg(cfv(cim, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)))
  3eqtr4d(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), cneg(cfv(cim, c0)), cfv(cre, cneg(co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0))), cneg(cfv(cre, co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)))

  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)), wcel(co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0), cc), wcel(cneg(ci), cc), wcel(c0, cc))

  syl5eqr(co(ci, cmul, c0), cneg(co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0)), co(cneg(cneg(ci)), cmul, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cim, c0), cle, nat0)))

blocks.name: asinlem3
blocks.content: The argument to the logarithm in ~ df-asin has nonnegative real part. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm asinlem3(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))))))
} = {
  lecasei(nat0, cfv(cim, c0), wcel(c0, cc), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))))))
  0red(wcel(c0, cc))
  breqtrrd(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), co(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(cabs, co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2))))), cexp, nat2)), cmul, cfv(cre, cfv(ccj, co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2))))))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cim, c0))))
  mulge0d(co(nat1, cdiv, co(cfv(cabs, co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2))))), cexp, nat2)), cfv(cre, cfv(ccj, co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2)))))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cim, c0))))
  recld(cfv(ccj, co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2))))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cim, c0))))

  negicn()
  logcld(co(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
  addcld(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))

  ax-icn()
  mulcl(ci, cv(hs0))
  sqrtcld(co(nat1, cmin, co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
  sylancr(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wcel(co(nat1, cmin, co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2)), cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), cc))

thm asinf() {
  ⊢ (arcsin : ℂ → ℂ)
} = {
  fmpti(hs0, casin, cc, cc, (-u(i)[×](log `((i[×]hs0)[+](sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2)))))))
  df-asin(hs0)
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ ℂ, (-u(i)[×](log `((i[×]hs0)[+](sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2))))))∈ ℂ, -u(i)∈ ℂ, (log `((i[×]hs0)[+](sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2)))))∈ ℂ)
  negicn()
  logcld(((i[×]hs0)[+](sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2)))), hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  addcld((i[×]hs0), (sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2))), hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  mpan(hs0 ∈ ℂ, (i[×]hs0)∈ ℂ, i ∈ ℂ)
  ax-icn()
  mulcl(ci, hs0)
  sqrtcld((1[-](hs0[^]2)), hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ ℂ, (1[-](hs0[^]2))∈ ℂ, 1 ∈ ℂ, (hs0[^]2)∈ ℂ)
  ax-1cn()
  sqcl(hs0)
  subcl(nat1, (hs0[^]2))
  asinlem(hs0)
  mulcl(-u(i), (log `((i[×]hs0)[+](sqrt `(1[-](hs0[^]2))))))
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
}

blocks.name: atandm
blocks.content: Since the property is a little lengthy, we abbreviate ` A e. CC /\ A =/= -u _i /\ A =/= _i ` as ` A e. dom arctan ` . This is the necessary precondition for the definition of ` arctan ` to make sense. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)

thm atandm(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cdm(catan)), w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, cneg(ci)), wne(c0, ci)))

  bitri(wcel(c0, cdif(cc, cpr(cneg(ci), ci))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wa(wne(c0, cneg(ci)), wne(c0, ci))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wn(wcel(c0, cpr(cneg(ci), ci)))))
  eldif(c0, cc, cpr(cneg(ci), ci))
  pm5.32i(wcel(c0, cc), wn(wcel(c0, cpr(cneg(ci), ci))), wa(wne(c0, cneg(ci)), wne(c0, ci)))
  syl6bbr(wcel(c0, cc), wn(wcel(c0, cpr(cneg(ci), ci))), wa(wne(c0, cneg(ci)), wne(c0, ci)), wn(wo(wceq(c0, cneg(ci)), wceq(c0, ci))))
  notbid(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c0, cpr(cneg(ci), ci)), wo(wceq(c0, cneg(ci)), wceq(c0, ci)))
  elprg(c0, cc, cneg(ci), ci)
  neanior(c0, cneg(ci), c0, ci)
  eleq2i(c0, cdm(catan), cdif(cc, cpr(cneg(ci), ci)))
  dmmpti(hs0, catan, cdif(cc, cpr(cneg(ci), ci)), co(co(ci, cdiv, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)))), cmin, cfv(clog, co(nat1, caddc, co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)))))))
  ovex(co(ci, cdiv, nat2), cmul, co(cfv(clog, co(nat1, cmin, co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)))), cmin, cfv(clog, co(nat1, caddc, co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0))))))
  df-atan(hs0)
  3anass(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, cneg(ci)), wne(c0, ci))

thm atandm(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ dom(arctan)↔(c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i))
} = {
  3bitr4i(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i), c0 ∈(ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i)))
  bitri(c0 ∈(ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧(c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ ¬ c0 ∈ { -u(i), i }))
  eldif(c0, cc, { -u(i), i })
  pm5.32i(c0 ∈ ℂ, ¬ c0 ∈ { -u(i), i }, (c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i))
  syl6bbr(c0 ∈ ℂ, ¬ c0 ∈ { -u(i), i }, (c0 ≠ -u(i)∧ c0 ≠ i), ¬(c0 = -u(i)∨ c0 = i))
  notbid(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ { -u(i), i }, (c0 = -u(i)∨ c0 = i))
  elprg(c0, cc, -u(i), ci)
  neanior(c0, -u(i), c0, ci)
  eleq2i(c0, dom(arctan), (ℂ \ { -u(i), i }))
  dmmpti(hs0, catan, (ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), ((i[÷]2)[×]((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0))))))
  ovex((i[÷]2), cmul, ((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0)))))
  df-atan(hs0)
  3anass(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ -u(i), c0 ≠ i)
  diff.hs0.c((ℂ \ { -u(i), i }))
}

thm atanf() {
  ⊢ (arctan :(ℂ \ { -u(i), i })→ ℂ)
} = {
  fmpti(hs0, catan, (ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), cc, ((i[÷]2)[×]((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0))))))
  sylbir(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), ((i[÷]2)[×]((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0)))))∈ ℂ, hs0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  eleq2i(hs0, dom(arctan), (ℂ \ { -u(i), i }))
  dmmpti(hs0, catan, (ℂ \ { -u(i), i }), ((i[÷]2)[×]((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0))))))
  ovex((i[÷]2), cmul, ((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0)))))
  df-atan(hs0)
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), ((i[÷]2)[×]((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0)))))∈ ℂ, (i[÷]2)∈ ℂ, ((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0))))∈ ℂ)
  ax-mp((i[÷]2)∈ ℂ, i ∈ ℂ)
  halfcl(ci)
  subcld((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0))), (log `(1[+](i[×]hs0))), hs0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  logcld((1[-](i[×]hs0)), hs0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[-](i[×]hs0))∈ ℂ, 1 ∈ ℂ, (i[×]hs0)∈ ℂ)
  subcl(nat1, (i[×]hs0))
  simp2bi(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[-](i[×]hs0))≠ 0, hs0 ∈ ℂ, (1[+](i[×]hs0))≠ 0)
  logcld((1[+](i[×]hs0)), hs0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[+](i[×]hs0))∈ ℂ, 1 ∈ ℂ, (i[×]hs0)∈ ℂ)
  ax-1cn()
  sylancr(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), (i[×]hs0)∈ ℂ, i ∈ ℂ, hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  ax-icn()
  simp1bi(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), hs0 ∈ ℂ, (1[-](i[×]hs0))≠ 0, (1[+](i[×]hs0))≠ 0)
  mulcl(ci, hs0)
  addcl(nat1, (i[×]hs0))
  simp3bi(hs0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[+](i[×]hs0))≠ 0, hs0 ∈ ℂ, (1[-](i[×]hs0))≠ 0)
  atandm2(hs0)
  mulcl((i[÷]2), ((log `(1[-](i[×]hs0)))[-](log `(1[+](i[×]hs0)))))
  diff.hs0.c((ℂ \ { -u(i), i }))
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
}

blocks.name: atanre
blocks.content: A real number is in the domain of the arctangent function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm atanre(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cdm(catan)))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cdm(catan)), wcel(c0, cc), wne(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cneg(nat1)))
  recn(c0)
  gtned(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cneg(nat1), wcel(c0, cr))
  ltletrd(cneg(nat1), co(c0, cexp, nat2), nat0, wcel(c0, cr))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cneg(nat1), cr))
  neg1rr()
  0red(wcel(c0, cr))
  resqcl(c0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(cneg(nat1), clt, nat0))
  neg1lt0()
  sqge0(c0)
  atandm3(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atanre(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ → c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
} = {
  sylanbrc(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ dom(arctan), c0 ∈ ℂ, (c0[^]2)≠ -u(1))
  recn(c0)
  gtned((c0[^]2), -u(1), c0 ∈ ℝ)
  ltletrd(-u(1), (c0[^]2), nat0, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℝ, -u(1)∈ ℝ)
  neg1rr()
  0red(c0 ∈ ℝ)
  resqcl(c0)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℝ, -u(1)[<]0)
  neg1lt0()
  sqge0(c0)
  atandm3(c0)
}

blocks.name: acosneg
blocks.content: The negative symmetry relation of the arccosine. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm acosneg(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cacos, cneg(c0)), co(cpi, cmin, cfv(cacos, c0))))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(cfv(cacos, cneg(c0)), co(cpi, cmin, cfv(cacos, c0)), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, cneg(c0))), co(cpi, cmin, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  3eqtr4d(co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, cneg(c0))), co(cpi, cmin, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0))), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cneg(cfv(casin, c0))), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), caddc, cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cneg(cfv(casin, c0))), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), caddc, cfv(casin, c0))), wcel(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cc), wcel(cfv(casin, c0), cc))
  subneg(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cfv(casin, c0))
  oveq2d(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, cneg(c0)), cneg(cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  asinneg(c0)
  syl6eq(co(cpi, cmin, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0))), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), caddc, cfv(casin, c0)), co(co(cpi, cmin, co(cpi, cdiv, nat2)), caddc, cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  subsubd(cpi, co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cfv(casin, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cpi, cc))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cc))
  asincl(c0)
  oveq1i(co(cpi, cmin, co(cpi, cdiv, nat2)), caddc, cfv(casin, c0), co(cpi, cdiv, nat2))
  subaddrii(cpi, co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), co(cpi, cdiv, nat2))
  ax-mp(wcel(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cc), wcel(cpi, cc))
  picn()
  halfcl(cpi)
  pidiv2halves()
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cacos, cneg(c0)), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, cneg(c0)))), wcel(cneg(c0), cc))
  negcl(c0)
  acosval(cneg(c0))
  oveq2d(cpi, cmin, cfv(cacos, c0), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  acosval(c0)
}

thm acosneg(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(arccos ` -u(c0))=(π[-](arccos ` c0)))
} = {
  3eqtr4d((arccos ` -u(c0)), (π[-](arccos ` c0)), ((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` -u(c0))), (π[-]((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0))), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  3eqtr4d(((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` -u(c0))), (π[-]((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0))), ((π[÷]2)[-]-u((arcsin ` c0))), ((π[÷]2)[+](arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((π[÷]2)[-]-u((arcsin ` c0)))=((π[÷]2)[+](arcsin ` c0)), (π[÷]2)∈ ℂ, (arcsin ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  subneg((π[÷]2), (arcsin ` c0))
  oveq2d((π[÷]2), cmin, (arcsin ` -u(c0)), -u((arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  asinneg(c0)
  syl6eq((π[-]((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0))), ((π[÷]2)[+](arcsin ` c0)), ((π[-](π[÷]2))[+](arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  subsubd(cpi, (π[÷]2), (arcsin ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℂ, π ∈ ℂ)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℂ, (π[÷]2)∈ ℂ)
  asincl(c0)
  oveq1i((π[-](π[÷]2)), caddc, (arcsin ` c0), (π[÷]2))
  subaddrii(cpi, (π[÷]2), (π[÷]2))
  ax-mp((π[÷]2)∈ ℂ, π ∈ ℂ)
  picn()
  halfcl(cpi)
  pidiv2halves()
  syl(c0 ∈ ℂ, (arccos ` -u(c0))=((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` -u(c0))), -u(c0)∈ ℂ)
  negcl(c0)
  acosval(-u(c0))
  oveq2d(cpi, cmin, (arccos ` c0), ((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  acosval(c0)
}

  oveq2d(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0), co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(clog, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))))), wcel(c0, cc))

  oveq1i(co(ci, cmul, cneg(ci)), cmul, cfv(clog, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), nat1)
  3eqtri(co(ci, cmul, cneg(ci)), nat1, cneg(co(ci, cmul, ci)), cneg(cneg(nat1)))
  mulneg2i(ci, ci)
  negeqi(co(ci, cmul, ci), cneg(nat1))
  ixi()
  negneg1e1()
  mulid2d(cfv(clog, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), wcel(c0, cc))
  logcld(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl2anc(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))))), co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), wcel(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cc), wne(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), nat0))
  addcld(co(ci, cmul, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), wcel(c0, cc))

blocks.name: sinasin
blocks.content: The arcsine function is an inverse to ` sin ` . This is the main property that justifies the notation ` arcsin ` or ` sin ^ -u 1 ` . Because ` sin ` is not an injection, the other converse identity ~ asinsin is only true under limited circumstances. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sinasin(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(csin, cfv(casin, c0)), c0))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(csin, cfv(casin, c0)), c0, co(co(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)))), cdiv, co(nat2, cmul, ci)), wcel(c0, cc))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(csin, cfv(casin, c0)), co(co(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)))), cdiv, co(nat2, cmul, ci))), wcel(cfv(casin, c0), cc))
  sinval(cfv(casin, c0))
  mpbird(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)))), cdiv, co(nat2, cmul, ci)), c0), wceq(co(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)))), co(co(nat2, cmul, ci), cmul, c0)))
  3eqtr4d(co(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)))), co(co(nat2, cmul, ci), cmul, c0), co(co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cmin, co(cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))))), co(co(ci, cmul, c0), cmin, cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  pnpcan2d(co(ci, cmul, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2))), cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  negcld(co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cc))
  sqrtcld(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cc))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), cc), wcel(nat1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cc))
  ax-1cn()
  sqcl(c0)
  subcl(nat1, co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  oveq12d(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), cmin, cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), co(co(ci, cmul, c0), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), co(cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), wcel(c0, cc))
  efiasin(c0)
  3eqtrd(cfv(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0))), co(cneg(co(ci, cmul, c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(c0, cexp, nat2)))), cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, cneg(c0)))), co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2)))), wcel(c0, cc))
  fveq2d(ce, co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)), co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, cneg(c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  eqtr4d(co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)), co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, cneg(c0))), co(ci, cmul, cneg(cfv(casin, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(cneg(ci), cmul, cfv(casin, c0)), co(ci, cmul, cneg(cfv(casin, c0)))), wcel(ci, cc), wcel(cfv(casin, c0), cc))
  mulneg12(ci, cfv(casin, c0))
  oveq2d(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, cneg(c0)), cneg(cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  asinneg(c0)
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ce, co(ci, cmul, cfv(casin, cneg(c0)))), co(co(ci, cmul, cneg(c0)), caddc, cfv(csqrt, co(nat1, cmin, co(cneg(c0), cexp, nat2))))), wcel(cneg(c0), cc))

blocks.name: asinsin
blocks.content: The arcsine function composed with ` sin ` is equal to the identity. This plus ~ sinasin allow us to view ` sin ` and ` arcsin ` as inverse operations to each other. For ease of use, we have not defined precisely the correct domain of correctness of this identity; in addition to the main region described here it is also true for _some_ points on the branch cuts, namely when ` A = ( _pi / 2 ) - _i y ` for nonnegative real ` y ` and also symmetrically at ` A = _i y - ( _pi / 2 ) ` . In particular, when restricted to reals this identity extends to the closed interval ` [ -u ( _pi / 2 ) , ( _pi / 2 ) ] ` , not just the open interval (see ~ reasinsin ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm asinsin(class c0) {

blocks.name: acoscos
blocks.content: The arccosine function is an inverse to ` cos ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: sinacos
blocks.content: The sine of the arccosine of ` A ` is ` sqrt ( 1 - A ^ 2 ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2015.)

thm sinacos(class c0) {

  eqtrd(co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(cacos, c0)), cfv(casin, c0), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  oveq2d(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(cacos, c0), co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  acosval(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(casin, c0))), cfv(casin, c0)), wcel(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cc), wcel(cfv(casin, c0), cc))
  ax-mp(wcel(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cc), wcel(cpi, cc))
  picn()
  halfcl(cpi)
  asincl(c0)
  nncan(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cfv(casin, c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(ccos, co(co(cpi, cdiv, nat2), cmin, cfv(cacos, c0))), cfv(csin, cfv(cacos, c0))), wcel(cfv(cacos, c0), cc))

thm sinacos(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(sin `(arccos ` c0))=(sqrt `(1[-](c0[^]2))))
} = {
  3eqtr3d((sin `(arccos ` c0)), (sqrt `(1[-](c0[^]2))), (cos `((π[÷]2)[-](arccos ` c0))), (cos `(arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  fveq2d(ccos, ((π[÷]2)[-](arccos ` c0)), (arcsin ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  eqtrd(((π[÷]2)[-](arccos ` c0)), (arcsin ` c0), ((π[÷]2)[-]((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0))), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  oveq2d((π[÷]2), cmin, (arccos ` c0), ((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  acosval(c0)
  sylancr(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((π[÷]2)[-]((π[÷]2)[-](arcsin ` c0)))=(arcsin ` c0), (π[÷]2)∈ ℂ, (arcsin ` c0)∈ ℂ)
  ax-mp((π[÷]2)∈ ℂ, π ∈ ℂ)
  picn()
  halfcl(cpi)
  asincl(c0)
  nncan((π[÷]2), (arcsin ` c0))

  acoscl(c0)

blocks.name: atancj
blocks.content: The arctangent function distributes under conjugation. (The condition that ` Re ( A ) =/= 0 ` is necessary because the branch cuts are chosen so that the negative imaginary line "agrees with" neighboring values with negative real part, while the positive imaginary line agrees with values with positive real part. This makes ~ atanneg true unconditionally but messes up conjugation symmetry, and it is impossible to have both in a single-valued function. The claim is true on the imaginary line between ` -u 1 ` and ` 1 ` , though.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: atanrecl
blocks.content: The arctangent function is real for all real inputs. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm atanrecl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cfv(catan, c0), cr))
} = {

  0re()
  cjrebd(cfv(catan, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0)))

  simprd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0)), wceq(cfv(ccj, cfv(catan, c0)), cfv(catan, cfv(ccj, c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(catan)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0)), wa(wcel(c0, cdm(catan)), wceq(cfv(ccj, cfv(catan, c0)), cfv(catan, cfv(ccj, c0)))), wcel(c0, cc), wne(cfv(cre, c0), nat0))
  recnd(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0))
  eqnetrd(cfv(cre, c0), nat0, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wne(c0, nat0)))

blocks.pretty:
thm atanrecl(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℝ →(arctan ` c0)∈ ℝ)
} = {
  pm2.61dane(c0, nat0, c0 ∈ ℝ, (arctan ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  syl6eqel((arctan ` c0), cr, (arctan ` 0), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 = 0))
  fveq2d(catan, c0, nat0, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 = 0))
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 = 0)
  eqeltri((arctan ` 0), cr, nat0)
  atan0()
  0re()
  cjrebd((arctan ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  syl((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), (arctan ` c0)∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ 0, c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  atanre(c0)
  atancl(c0)
  eqtrd((* `(arctan ` c0)), (arctan ` c0), (arctan `(* ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  simprd((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), (* `(arctan ` c0))=(arctan `(* ` c0)), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), (c0 ∈ dom(arctan)∧(* `(arctan ` c0))=(arctan `(* ` c0))), c0 ∈ ℂ, (Re ` c0)≠ 0)
  recnd(c0, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ 0)
  eqnetrd((Re ` c0), nat0, c0, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ 0, (Re ` c0)= c0)
  rere(c0)
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ 0)
  atancj(c0)
  fveq2d(catan, (* ` c0), c0, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ 0, (* ` c0)= c0)
  cjre(c0)
}

blocks.name: atanlogadd
blocks.content: The rule ` sqrt ( z w ) = ( sqrt z ) ( sqrt w ) ` is not always true on the complex numbers, but it is true when the arguments of ` z ` and ` w ` sum to within the interval ` ( -u _pi , _pi ] ` , so there are some cases such as this one with ` z = 1 + _i A ` and ` w = 1 - _i A ` which are true unconditionally. This result can also be stated as " ` sqrt ( 1 + z ) + sqrt ( 1 - z ) ` is analytic". (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Apr-2015.)

} = {
  3eqtrd((cos `(arctan ` c0)), (1[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), (((exp `(i[×](arctan ` c0)))[+](exp `(-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0))))[÷]2), ((2[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2))))[÷]2), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))

  cosval((arctan ` c0))
  oveq1d(((exp `(i[×](arctan ` c0)))[+](exp `(-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0)))), cdiv, nat2, (2[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  3eqtr2d(((exp `(i[×](arctan ` c0)))[+](exp `(-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0)))), (2[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), (((1[+](i[×]c0))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2))))[+]((1[-](i[×]c0))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2))))), (((1[+](i[×]c0))[+](1[-](i[×]c0)))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  oveq12d((exp `(i[×](arctan ` c0))), caddc, (exp `(-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0))), ((1[+](i[×]c0))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), ((1[-](i[×]c0))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  efiatan2(c0)
  3eqtrd((exp `(-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0))), ((1[-](i[×]c0))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), (exp `(i[×](arctan ` -u(c0)))), ((1[+](i[×]-u(c0)))[÷](sqrt `(1[+](-u(c0)[^]2)))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  fveq2d(ce, (-u(i)[×](arctan ` c0)), (i[×](arctan ` -u(c0))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))

  oveq2d(ci, cmul, (arctan ` -u(c0)), -u((arctan ` c0)), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))

thm cosatanne0(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ dom(arctan)→(cos `(arctan ` c0))≠ 0)
} = {
  eqnetrd((cos `(arctan ` c0)), nat0, (1[÷](sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  cosatan(c0)
  recne0d((sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2))), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  mpbid(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), (sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))≠ 0, ((sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))[^]2)≠ 0)
  eqnetrd(((sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))[^]2), nat0, (1[+](c0[^]2)), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  sqsqrtd((1[+](c0[^]2)), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  simprbi(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[+](c0[^]2))≠ 0, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  syl(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), (((sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))[^]2)≠ 0 ↔(sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))≠ 0), (sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2)))∈ ℂ)
  sqrtcld((1[+](c0[^]2)), c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  sylancr(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), (1[+](c0[^]2))∈ ℂ, 1 ∈ ℂ, (c0[^]2)∈ ℂ)
  ax-1cn()
  sqcld(c0, c0 ∈ dom(arctan))
  simplbi(c0 ∈ dom(arctan), c0 ∈ ℂ, (1[+](c0[^]2))≠ 0)
  atandm4(c0)
  addcl(nat1, (c0[^]2))
  sqne0((sqrt `(1[+](c0[^]2))))
}

blocks.name: atantan
blocks.content: The arctangent function is an inverse to ` tan ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Apr-2015.)

  ovex(nat1, cdiv, co(nat1, caddc, co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2)))

blocks.name: leibpi
blocks.content: The Leibniz formula for ` _pi ` . This proof depends on three main facts: (1) the series ` F ` is convergent, because it is an alternating series ( ~ iseralt ). (2) Using ~ leibpilem2 to rewrite the series as a power series, it is the ` x = 1 ` special case of the Taylor series for ` arctan ` ( ~ atantayl2 ). (3) Although we cannot directly plug ` x = 1 ` into ~ atantayl2 , Abel's theorem ( ~ abelth2 ) says that the limit along any sequence converging to ` 1 ` , such as ` 1 - 1 / n ` , of the power series converges to the power series extended to ` 1 ` , and then since ` arctan ` is continuous at ` 1 ` ( ~ atancn ) we get the desired result. This is Metamath 100 proof #26. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: leibpisum
blocks.content: The Leibniz formula for ` _pi ` . This version of ~ leibpi looks nicer but does not assert that the series is convergent so is not as practically useful. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm leibpisum(setvar s0) {
  |- wceq(csu(s0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1))), co(cpi, cdiv, nat4))
} = {
  mptru(wceq(csu(s0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1))), co(cpi, cdiv, nat4)))
  isumclim(s0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)), co(cpi, cdiv, nat4), nat0, cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))), wtru)
  nn0uz()
  0zd(wtru)
  adantl(wtru, wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wceq(cfv(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))), cv(s0)), co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1))))
  fvmpt(hs0, cv(s0), cn0, cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))), co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)), co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1)))
  oveq12d(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1), co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cv(s0), cneg(nat1), cexp)
  oveq1d(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1, co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), cv(s0), nat2, cmul)
  ovex(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1))
  adantl(wtru, wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)), cc))
  recnd(co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cn0))
  nndivred(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1), wcel(cv(s0), cn0))
  mpan(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cr), wcel(cneg(nat1), cr))
  neg1rr()
  reexpcl(cneg(nat1), cv(s0))
  syl(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1), cn), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), cn0))
  mpan(wcel(cv(s0), cn0), wcel(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), cn0), wcel(nat2, cn0))
  2nn0()
  nn0mulcl(nat2, cv(s0))
  nn0p1nn(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)))
  a1i(wtru, wbr(cseq(nat0, caddc, cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1)))), cli, co(cpi, cdiv, nat4)))
  leibpi(hs0, cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))))
  diff.nat0.s(s0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1)))
  diff.cn0.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1))

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

  diff.caddc.s(s0)

  diff.wtru.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)

blocks.name: log2cnv
blocks.content: Using the Taylor series for ` arctan ( _i / 3 ) ` , produce a rapidly convergent series for ` log 2 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.)

  eqeltrd(cfv(cmpt(s0, cn0, co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s0)), cmul, co(co(co(ci, cdiv, nat3), cexp, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)), cdiv, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s0)), caddc, nat1)))), cv(hs0)), cc, co(ci, cdiv, co(co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1), cmul, co(nat3, cexp, co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(hs0)), caddc, nat1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cn0))
